modules.description: This module provides functions to inspect and manipulate the memory layout of OCaml values, exposing their low-level structure through types like `block`, `pblock`, and `closinfo`. It allows creating explicit representations of values with `repr` and traversing memory graphs with `follow` and `walk`, capturing details like pointers, tags, and closure environments. Concrete use cases include analyzing closure layouts, tracking memory sharing, and debugging value representations in OCaml programs.

This module generates Graphviz DOT representations of OCaml values, rendering memory structures as visual graphs. It works with lists of labeled memory cells, allowing configuration of graph appearance such as node colors and layout direction. Use it to visualize complex data structures like linked lists or trees for debugging or educational purposes.

This module provides tools for visualizing and inspecting the memory structure of OCaml values. It includes functions to generate Graphviz DOT representations of data structures and to analyze low-level value layouts using types like `block`, `pblock`, and `closinfo`. Use it to debug complex structures like closures, linked lists, or trees by inspecting pointers, tags, and memory sharing directly.
